snippet: Reductions at The Wall Street Journal eliminated reporting teams and some international bureaus, though the editor said jobs would be added in other areas.
abstract: Dow Jones initiates sweeping round of job reductions at The Wall Street Journal, eliminating entire teams of reporters and closing international bureaus; cuts are justified as part of transition to more digital operation, and follow report that news-related revenue at parent News Corp was down 9 percent in most recent quarter.
lead_paragraph: Reductions at The Wall Street Journal eliminated reporting teams and some international bureaus, though the editor said jobs would be added in other areas.

headline.main: Dow Jones Begins New Round of Layoffs
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Journal Cuts Jobs and Closes Some Bureaus
